taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family Asteraceae;tribe Heliantheae;subtribe Helianthinae;genus Helianthus;species paradoxus;

bio:treatment.discussion: Helianthus paradoxus is listed by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service as an endangered species and is in the Center for Plant Conservationâ€™s National Collection of Endangered Plants. It is of hybrid origin; the parents are H. annuus and H. petiolaris (L. H. Rieseberg et al. 1990). It occupies a different habitat type than either parent (H. annuus usually on clay-based mesic soils and H. petiolaris usually on dry, sandy soils).
